CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 9, 1947, pg. 17, reads: "Boosters for Democracy - Marjorie Long, who was here to appear on the Night of Stars, given by the Frogs Monday night, is shown with her brother, James Long, a radio announcer for Station WLOA, Braddock. Miss Long is the girl who refused to draw another raffle ticket for the Kiwanis Club in Ahoskie, N. C., when members tried to keep the winner from receiving the prize of a brand new Cadillac because he was a Negro. Pittsburgh people, the Longs are real boosters for democracy. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marjorie Long with camera over shoulder, and her brother James Long, posed in front of Syria Mosque, Oakland
